task.title: Install Docker and Set up the Requirements

step.cmd: Download the Docker application version 18.0 or later from .
Follow the install wizard to accept the license, authorize the installer, and proceed with the installation.
Right-click the Docker icon in the task bar and select Settings.

In the Shared Drives screen, select the C drive as your preferred local drive for the container. If you do not select the C drive, an error message appears that there is not enough memory while launching the Plant Applications services.
In the Advanced screen, specify CPUs as 4 and Memory as 22 GB. This is necessary to have enough space to run the Docker images.
In the Proxies screen, select the Manual proxy configuration radio button and enter the proxy settings of your environment. By default, the No Proxy radio button is selected.

info.note: In the bypass for hosts and domains box, you must add the IP address of your DTR machine, if you want to use the existing DTR account.

step.cmd: In the Daemon screen, Specify the IP address of your machine in the Insecure Registries box for creating a local DTR account.

taskbody.postreq: Install Plant Applications Universal Client Docker to access the Plant Applications.
